tr.td: Title:Star Formation in Cooling Core Clusters

body.div: Is the excess blue emission often seen in cooling flow (CF) clusters due to the CF phenomenon, or is there another environmental or nuclear process at work in these galaxies? We propose to localize and characterize the young stellar populations in central galaxies of CF clusters. In 2005, we obtained excellent data for 5 clusters which confirmed that the technical aspects of the project are feasible. We propose here to add to the work of the previous semesters by collecting a sample of clusters, including critically important controls, which will be large enough for us to obtain information on the evolution of the central galaxy in relation to the CF, the central AGN, and the role of galaxy-galaxy interactions within the cluster.

ul.li:
[data] [ADS] The diverse nature of optical emission lines in brightest cluster galaxies: IFU observations of the central kiloparsec
[data] [ADS] The relation between line emission and brightest cluster galaxies in three exceptional clusters: evidence for gas cooling from the intracluster medium
